result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: TO BE PAID IN FULL DURING TERM OF PROBATION.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment Defendant must not leave or change employment without prior approval of his probation agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes:
To be completed during the first 6 months of probation.

supervisions.notes: Restitution was paid in full.  A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Grams.  Parties have the revocation summary.  No changes or corrections.  State recommends:  In 15CM192-  90 days jail.  6 months jail in 15CM95 and 15CM200 concurrent.  7 days credit.  Defense recommends:  Time served.  110 days credit on each case.  Court ordered: 90 days jail in 15CM192, time served.  6 months jail in 15CM95.   6 months jail in 15CM200.  Concurrent.  Credit for  110 days.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
sent to Judge Becker electronically 9/21/16.  JMM
from DOC

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Grams.  Plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CM200.  Plead  guilty to domestic DC in 15CM192.  Plead guilty to Obstructing and  OWI first in 15CM95.  Dismiss, but read in all other counts.  Court recited the charges, possible penalties, and elements of the charges he plead to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty as plead to.  State moved to dismiss refusal as reasonable,  and Count 3 15CM95.  Granted.  Joint recommendation for 18 mo probation.  Concurrent.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA if recommended.  Subject to random testing.  $90.00 restitution.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. On  the  OWI 1st charge:  Total fine of $887.50.  9 mo. DL rev.  IID.  Alc assmt & dsp.   40 hours CS within 1st 6 months of probation.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.   Court ordered:  sentence withheld:  18 mo. probation.  Concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   AODA if recommended.  Subject to random testing.  $90.00 restitution.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  40 hours CS within 1st 6 months of probation. Obtain and maintain employment.  CC   DNA sample and surcharge. On the OWI 1st charge:  fine of $887.50.  9 mo. DL rev.  IID.  Alcohol assessment and driver's safety plan.  Pay @ $50/mo starting 3/15.  Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.
Restitution worksheet.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Grams.  Set 15CM95 for jury trial. Next 15CM192, then 15CM200.  1 day each.
Final pre-trial at 06-20-2016 03:00 pm
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 09:00 am

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  Walmart store.
Status conference at 01-11-2016 03:00 pm

No reporter - recorded.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail without counsel present.  CC Rewald set a $300 cash bond to cover 15CM200, 15CM192, and 15CM95 with all conditions that were previously ordered.  Warrant is quashed.  Defendant is to contact the attorney he had previously.
On morning yellow jail sheet.

No appearance by defendant.  Attorney Kasey Grams appears.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Grams states she has not had any contact with client since last court appearance.  Court authorizes a warrant.
